tweets.text: @WildStoke @StaffsUni @TalesofaWildGuy @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @TrentCaba @jogideon I had a walk this evening and had chance to take some photos... https://t.co/wSRbDWMG3s

@WildStoke @StaffsUni @TalesofaWildGuy @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @TrentCaba @jogideon Be good to see more reported on this. Sounds like an area other projects may be able to learn from. The most useful bits of evaluation are often where things didn‚Äôt perform exactly as expected.

Alongside responding to flooding, our Ely field team has cleared vegetation on an overgrown channel near Oakington village to help reduce flood risk.

Here‚Äôs a photo of before, during and after the works. #flood #Oakington https://t.co/Fh7Hvr7T3d

A year ago today, #StormCiara caused devastation in Calderdale. Today, we're looking back at the impact of Storm Ciara and celebrating Calderdale's amazing community spirit and resilienceüíö

Follow our social media takeover as we look ahead at plans to build greater resilience. https://t.co/yznEHfMzUf

We continue to work in partnership with the @EnvAgencyYNE, @YorkshireWater and other partners and communities to develop a catchment-wide approach to reduce flood risk, including the use of natural flood management techniques and reservoir storage.

#resilience https://t.co/1D1cf12qtE

On site in Sykehouse again with partners from @EnvAgencyYNE and @SYFR. @MyDoncaster gritting team helping to ensure fire and rescue colleagues can access the pumping site safely. üëçüèª https://t.co/vHYIrf1TlU
Check out this fab #knaresborough viaduct and River #Nidd from my 5year old homeschooling today.  Apprenticeship clearly starting early!  ü§î #chipofftheoldblock https://t.co/DcZaTyWAla

tweets.text:
6 days to go‚Ä¶

The 3 phased #Kendal Flood Risk Management Scheme has been designed with members of the local community & partners.

6km of earth embankments and flood walls will be constructed and will include glass panels at key viewpoints.

More info‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/XTYr7iYCo9 https://t.co/33wqVDYMo3

Never drive through flood water. 

It's the number one cause of death during floods and even relatively shallow water can move your car or wreck its engine.

https://t.co/vhT6xEotas https://t.co/EGhXllzz90

tweets.text: We have staff at #HolmeFleet #PortClarence, working to resolve increased water levels due to a blocked culvert. Levels are stable but we are working with partners and the landowner to pump water out of the flooded area to ensure homes and infrastructure are protected. #flooding https://t.co/TagPTH5qXA

All park friend groups in Liverpool with lakes, illegal fishing is taking place using nets across the parks & Lpool canal. Please check your lakes daily, inform anglers & report to @EnvAgency and remove if found. @teire @FOPP2018 @RobertaPeak2 @ILoveSeftonPark @of_fonp https://t.co/pHwAqwuZ4U

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

Who‚Äôs seen our #BinTheWipe ads on TV?

Give us a like if you have!

Don‚Äôt worry if not ‚Äì here‚Äôs one for you to watch now!

RT if you know someone who needs to see it. 

Everyone flusher converted is a win for protecting homes, the environment & wildlife.

@EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/JWrxFkq8NV

More surveying today! Mapping the flood plain at our leaky dams at @ForestryEngland Matterdale to calculate how much we can #slowtheflow. Part of our #naturalfloodmanagement monitoring programme with @LancsUniLEC. 

@EnvAgencyNW #WEG https://t.co/1wFMLty6CL

tweets.text:
The Lower Mole Flood Alleviation Scheme needs to be updated for the future. 
If you‚Äôre affected by this then we would like to hear your views on some new options to update the scheme.
To find out more and explore the options go to: https://t.co/iCbdEFW9Us #LowerMoleFAS https://t.co/CQ64beq4Go

One year on from #StormCiara, flood defences in #Mytholmroyd better protect 400 homes and businesses from flooding. We couldn‚Äôt have done this without working with @Calderdale, the community & partners, to make Mytholmroyd more resilient to climate change. https://t.co/9Qtxpf5YhQ https://t.co/8r6eAqq1a5

tweets.text: @IvelRev @KathrynMackenz6 @AffinityWater @OliverHealdUK @EnvAgency @AquiferChalk This is indeed great to see.  But to cut the abstraction rate, either water needs to be taken from somewhere else instead or we simply need to use less of it. Neither of which is that easy, sadly... Hopefully with groundwater at a long-term high, things might be ok for a bit
@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency If it helps, screenshots of previous chats: from October, November, December and January. https://t.co/VJNr79aLAX
@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Oh I see, our engineers will be sure to make sure it's all sorted

@Calderdale @HalfpennyKerry @floodmary @mrsk3r @slowtheflow_UK @CalderdaleFound @FloodDigitalEA @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgency @johncurtinEA @mpsinstltd @MeganClinch @ScottAPatient @BBCNWT @BBCLookNorth @SCcrowther @DefraGovUK https://t.co/1Bo3O4LrlI

tweets.text: @AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency That item is dated 31 October on the map... from the first time I reported this. Subsequently reported in November, December and a couple of wks back too. Some work has been done, but not stopped discharge?
@MrsTwilks Hiya, thanks for this @MrsTwilks. Would you be able to call us on 0800 80 70 60 and report this to our hotline so it gets passed to the right team to investigate. ^Katy

@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Thanks Peter, so it looks like from the notification you have sent me just then from the In Your Area section, that we are currently on site working on this issue right now. - Austin
@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency https://t.co/NFbfOb7S0r

@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Hi Peter. I'm sorry to hear that this has happened again. I've raised that under a new job reference - 58258445 - but linked it to the previous occurrence. We'll be out asap today to get that sorted. Thanks for letting us know and sorry again, Kate

@AnglianWater @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency @AnglianWater I am told that this tank is once again overflowing as discharging (what I believe is) untreated sewage into the River Hiz chalk stream... what can be done here? Job ref 19058036 (31 October) refers
@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Hi Peter, I'm afraid it doesn't advise of what they found other than it needed dealing with as the tank was full. - Austin
@KathrynMackenz6 @AffinityWater @OliverHealdUK This is a nostalgic blast from the past. How the river used to be. @AffinityWater @EnvAgency this is what we want all year round. @AquiferChalk

Kids and adults you can help @severnunlocked by doing some   #citizenscience by watching some video footage of a fish pass and counting the number of fish that make it over https://t.co/HUV3J69haH

#Homeschooling @severnrivers  @LYR_Shropshire @EnvAgencyMids @CitSciAssoc https://t.co/I25L6SnvlG
